definitions: Forces (liquid, gas, or other substance) to move in a specific direction by means of a pump or similar mechanism.
Moves vigorously up and down or in and out.
Supplies (money, information, etc.) in large quantities.
Exercises (a muscle or part of the body) repeatedly to make it larger or stronger.
examples: The heart pumps blood throughout the body.
He pumps iron at the gym every day.
The company pumps millions into research.
The machine pumps water out of the basement.
